verses.verse: How beautiful <S%H3302><s%> <S%H8804><s%> are thy feet <S%H6471><s%> with shoes <S%H5275><s%>, O prince's <S%H5081><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> ! the joints <S%H2542><s%> of thy thighs <S%H3409><s%> are like jewels <S%H2481><s%>, the work <S%H4639><s%> of the hands <S%H3027><s%> of a cunning workman <S%H542><s%>.

Thy navel <S%H8326><s%> is like a round <S%H5469><s%> goblet <S%H101><s%>, which wanteth <S%H2637><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not liquor <S%H4197><s%>: thy belly <S%H990><s%> is like an heap <S%H6194><s%> of wheat <S%H2406><s%> set about <S%H5473><s%> <S%H8803><s%> with lilies <S%H7799><s%>.
Thy two <S%H8147><s%> breasts <S%H7699><s%> are like two <S%H8147><s%> young <S%H6082><s%> roes <S%H6646><s%> that are twins <S%H8380><s%>.

Thy neck <S%H6677><s%> is as a tower <S%H4026><s%> of ivory <S%H8127><s%>; thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> like the fishpools <S%H1295><s%> in Heshbon <S%H2809><s%>, by the gate <S%H8179><s%> of Bathrabbim <S%H1337><s%>: thy nose <S%H639><s%> is as the tower <S%H4026><s%> of Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> which looketh <S%H6822><s%> <S%H8802><s%> toward <S%H6440><s%> Damascus <S%H1834><s%>.

Thine head <S%H7218><s%> upon thee is like Karmel <S%H3760><s%>, and the hair <S%H1803><s%> of thine head <S%H7218><s%> like purple <S%H713><s%>; the king <S%H4428><s%> is held <S%H631><s%> <S%H8803><s%> in the galleries <S%H7298><s%>.
How fair <S%H3302><s%> <S%H8804><s%> and how pleasant <S%H5276><s%> <S%H8804><s%> art thou, O love <S%H160><s%>, for delights <S%H8588><s%> !
This thy stature <S%H6967><s%> is like <S%H1819><s%> <S%H8804><s%> to a palm tree <S%H8558><s%>, and thy breasts <S%H7699><s%> to clusters <S%H811><s%> of grapes.

I said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, I will go up <S%H5927><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to the palm tree <S%H8558><s%>, I will take hold <S%H270><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of the boughs <S%H5577><s%> thereof: now also thy breasts <S%H7699><s%> shall be as clusters <S%H811><s%> of the vine <S%H1612><s%>, and the smell <S%H7381><s%> of thy nose <S%H639><s%> like apples <S%H8598><s%>;

And the roof of thy mouth <S%H2441><s%> like the best <S%H2896><s%> wine <S%H3196><s%> for my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, that goeth <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8802><s%> down sweetly <S%H4339><s%>, causing the lips <S%H8193><s%> of those that are asleep <S%H3463><s%> to speak <S%H1680><s%> <S%H8802><s%>.
I am my beloved's <S%H1730><s%>, and his desire <S%H8669><s%> is toward me.

Come <S%H3212><s%> <S%H8798><s%>, my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, let us go forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8799><s%> into the field <S%H7704><s%>; let us lodge <S%H3885><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in the villages <S%H3723><s%>.

Let us get up early <S%H7925><s%> <S%H8686><s%> to the vineyards <S%H3754><s%>; let us see <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8799><s%> if the vine <S%H1612><s%> flourish <S%H6524><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, whether the tender grape <S%H5563><s%> appear <S%H6605><s%> <S%H8765><s%>, and the pomegranates <S%H7416><s%> bud forth <S%H5132><s%> <S%H8689><s%>: there will I give <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thee my loves <S%H1730><s%>.

The mandrakes <S%H1736><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8804><s%> a smell <S%H7381><s%>, and at our gates <S%H6607><s%> are all manner of pleasant <S%H4022><s%> fruits, new <S%H2319><s%> and old <S%H3465><s%>, which I have laid up <S%H6845><s%> <S%H8804><s%> for thee, O my beloved <S%H1730><s%>.
